pda.control

Class PdaCtrl

  • java.lang.Object
    • pda.control.PdaCtrl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class PdaCtrl
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The base class of PDA simulator. This class displays the PDA emulator and manages all the applications. In particular it manages the launcher
    Version:
    $Revision: 27 $
    Author:
    F. Merciol, D. Deveaux MAJ J-F. Kamp <{francois.merciol|daniel.deveaux}@univ-ubs.fr>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PdaCtrl()
      Initialize Pda datas and Pda ihm.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Callback function, reaction to button pushed.
      void addNewAppli(IApplication appli)
      Add a new application : this means that the application becomes visible on a new panel AND that the application is stored in the list of the applications running (at the SAME index that the new panel stored in the JTabbedPane).
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getApplicationsName()
      Get the array containing the names of the applications.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] arg)
      Starting of the PDA program.

      • addNewAppli

        public void addNewAppli(IApplication appli)
        Add a new application : this means that the application becomes visible on a new panel AND that the application is stored in the list of the applications running (at the SAME index that the new panel stored in the JTabbedPane).
        Parameters:
        appli - the new application to add in the PDA

      • getApplicationsName

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getApplicationsName()
        Get the array containing the names of the applications.
        Returns:
